title: Reality aside, silly World Series trend favors Nationals in Houston
text:
CLOSE SportsPulse: Game 5 was setting up to be a series defining game and then the Nationals received devastating news from their ace pitcher and the Astros capitalized. As Trysta Krick details, Washington is brink while the Astros are one game away from a classic comeback. USA TODAY

WASHINGTON — Not to worry, Nationals fans, the way this World Series is trending, Washington should win the next two games in Houston.

Yes, the Astros lead the best-of-seven series 3-2 with Justin Verlander on the mound for Game 6, but the road team has won the first five games of the World Series for just the third time in history.

"It's been a crazy year for us," said Nationals first baseman Ryan Zimmerman. "So why not have every road team win every game in the World Series?

"Why not?"

With the Series shifting back to Houston for Games 6 and 7 starting Tuesday, Nationals fans have a reason to believe — even with their ace Max Scherzer likely out with an injury for the rest of the series — that the momentum could change.

The Astros' 7-1 victory Sunday night marked the first time the road team won the first five games since 1996, when the Atlanta Braves won the first two games against the New York Yankees at Yankee Stadium, only to lose the next three at Atlanta-Fulton County Stadium. The Yankees won Game 6 at home to win the World Series.

Astros center fielder George Springer and shortstop Carlos Correa celebrate the win in Game 5. (Photo: Tommy Gilligan, USA TODAY Sports)

The first time it happened was in 1906, when the home team alternated each day. The Chicago White Sox won Games 1, 3 and 5 and the Cubs took Games 2 and 4.

The road team has never won each of the first six games.

“Yea, it’s a crazy stat," said Nationals pitcher Joe Ross, who started Game 5. "Hopefully we can finish through with it.”

And so is the scoring difference. The Nationals outscored the Astros 17-7 in the first two games at Minute Maid Park last week and Houston outscored Washington 19-3 in the last three games at Nationals Park.

"I think I would have rather played the last three games on the road, with the outcome," said Nationals shortstop Trea Turner.

Home field advantage matters, right?

History proves it does when it comes to Game 6 of the World Series. Home teams are 43-24, winning five of the last six.

Said Nationals manager Dave Martinez: "We won two games in Houston, we're going back to Houston to play Game 6, and here we go. That's all we've got to do is just worry about Game 6 right now."
description: The Astros' 7-1 win marked the third time in World Series history that the road team won the first 5 games. The road team has never won the first six.
